Our projects

Data for Democracy looks for projects that have a strong collaborative nature, and leverage data and technology to create positive social impact. We engage in a mix of community-led projects, which are proposed and self-organized by Data for Democracy members, and partner-led projects, which involve more formal collaboration with city governments and local and international NGOs.

Our project work is housed at GitHub, with many of our datasets residing at data.world.

  • Campaign Spending

    ProPublica

  • Climate Action Plan

    City of San Diego

  • Code of Ethics

    Data for Democracy is partnering with Bloomberg and BrightHive to develop a code of ethics for data scientists.

  • Insight Lane

    The D4D Crash Model

  • Drug Spending

    Medicare prescription expenditures

  • Election Transparency

    County-level US election results

  • Foreign Travel Expenditures

    ProPublica

  • Refugees

    Internal Displacement

  • USA Dashboard

    KPIs for the USA

  • Gerrymandering

    Princeton Election Consortium
